etymology.description: 龍(龍) (lóng, "dragon") and 華(華) (huá, "splendor; China") suggest a name evoking grandeur and cultural richness.
etymology.interpretation: 龍(龍) (lóng, "dragon") is often associated with power, authority, and good fortune, while 華(華) (huá, "splendor; China") conveys beauty and cultural brilliance. Together, 龍華(龍華) (Lónghuá) evokes an image of a culturally rich and prosperous place, which is fitting for areas named 龙华(龍華) in China, such as districts known for their historical or cultural significance.

examples.chinese: 龙华闪耀着古典魅力(龍華閃耀著古典魅力)。
在龙华(在龍華)，历史与现代交织(歷史與現代交織)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Lónghuá, lìshǐ yǔ xiàndài jiāozhī.
examples.english: In Longhua, history and modern life intertwine.
